Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PDounias
Reviews.Content: I was in New orleans in ealry November 2011 and I loved this little hotel. It is in a residential part of Lower Garden District almost halfway between the French Quarter and the epicenter of Magazine street. The area is great with not much sign of new builts, filled with beautiful wooden southern houses, with just a touch of New Orleans decadance (and I say that as a plus), but totaly safe. Transport is a piece of cake as the streetcar runs between the Uni and the French Quarter just a block away from the hotel. But even if you decide to walk, the quarter is just 30 min walk from the hotel and quite easy to follow. That is not recommended at night though as you need to pass from the business district which is a bit deserted after working hours. On the west, the core of Garden District, Magazine street and the old graveyards are withing comfortable walking distance. Also, oposite the streetcar station there are some great eateries with bbq, pizza (you have to try Slice!!!!) and po-boys. Now about the hotel itself, make sure you book yourself in Prytania Oak, NOT Prytania Park. They are under the same management (i think) but I only have an opinion about Oaks. To be honest, Park looks much shabbier than Oaks. The building is an old style southern house, not too lavish but full of character, the rooms look newly refurbished, there is a nice little backyard which is great for meeting your neighbors or you are a smoker like me. And we absolutely loved the room!! BIG, fat, comfortable bed with mosquito net, the kind you never come accross in Europe unfortunately, espresso machine, nice wooden floors, big bathroom with a fireplace (don't know if it's functioning). The only thing I could fault is the lack of plugs. I know it's not important but that shows the quality of the room. The biggest asset of this hotel for me is the fact that it adds to the N Orleans experience as it looks and feels unmistakenly southern at a very high quality level. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “well above average experience, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: youarenumber6
Reviews.Content: I love so many things about this hotel. Firstly, the location is within easy walking distance of several nice restaurants and a streetcar stop. It seemed safe when I visited, I didn't see any sketchy characters around although one would want to take the typical precautions for visiting an urban area. The room was slightly smallish but very comfortable. I was worried about being on the first floor but I never heard any noises above or beside me. And I'm not one to stay in a property merely because it's historical, but it's hard not to be impressed by what a beautiful building it is. Minus the modern amenities, you feel like you could be staying in New Orleans, circa 1915. The breakfast included with the stay is not particularly satisfying, but for such a small hotel I probably shouldn't hold that against them. There were several places to get breakfast in the neighborhood. I vacillated on 4 or 5 stars, but considering I got a good price on the room and that it seemed more reasonable than other upscale New Orleans small hotels, I'm giving them the extra star for value.

Reviews.Title: “First anniversary”
Reviews.Author: J9L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prytania Oaks the weekend of the French Quarter fest. We didn't want to stay in the French Quarter since it would be too loud and crowded. When I called to book out room Dori the GM was very nice and helpful with the availabilities. We originally booked a king room in the Queen Anne. Unfortunatly an irate customer arrived the day before and demanded our room. Dori called me to discuss the situation, showing that she cared about our stay and offered a different room at a discount for the incovenience - still a king, at the Prytania Oaks. She also said she could move the irate customer and regardless would have words with him. I appreciate how proactive and reasonable she was in light of the situation. When we arrived in our room there was a bottle of chilled champagne and pralines waiting for us, with a note from Dori congratulating us on our one year anniversary. Very thoughtful! We stayed in room 160, a lovely room; clean and cool, air conditioning worked great, very comfortable bed. We drank our champagne on the porch. The location is great, walking distance to the French Quarter and the Garden district. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Middlechild5-7
Reviews.Content: We just go back from a 2 night stay at the Prytania Oaks. I loved this boutique hotel. The location in the garden district was just what we wanted. About a block from a streetcar stop, so going into the French Quarter or the upper Garden district was easy. We did not move our car until we left. The room was perfect. I loved the charm and character. The pine wood floors, the coved ceiling and the nonworking fireplace and tile in front of the fireplace were beautiful. There were two sinks with granite countertops (one in the bathroom and one in the area near the coffee maker/refrig/closet set up). The bathroom was plenty spacious and had the same wood floors throughout. We had a room facing the street (I wanted in the historic part of the hotel) and heard some street noise at night, but not enough to disturb our sleep. The check in/out at the Prytania Park Hotel was easy, very nearby, in between the Oaks and the streetcar stop. No problem there. Every staff member we met from check in to housekeeping were nice and very polite and helpful. If I ever go back to New Orleans, would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ransonju
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over St Patricks day weekend. The Oaks is an easy half block walk from the office at the Park hotel. We were able to check in early and get a start on our sightseeing. We took the St Charles streetcar, which is a block away, down to the French quarter. The streetcar is cheap and convenient, but can be irregular in timing and can be packed at times. Late at night we found it easier to take a cab ( about $8 plus tip). We waited for about 40 minutes for a streetcar to come one night at the canal street stop. The front desk staff was very helpful setting us up on a tour she recommended (thank you Christine!).Â  The oaks is a short walk to the garden district attractions and we found it no issue to walk to and from the parade.Â  The room was nicely decorated with high ceilings. Large bathroom and a shower with great water pressure. The bed was comfortable.Â  I recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to have a lower priced alternative to staying in the French quarter. There is transportation to get you where you need to go and there are some good restaurants and bars on St Charles street a block from the hotel (sushi brothers is some of the best sushi I've ever had).Â

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway -- fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi911
Reviews.Content: Prytania OAKS is a lovely getaway in the Garden District. It is located one street from St. Charles and is convenient for catching the street car. It is within one block of two favorite restaurants -- Zea's Rotisserie Grill and The Irish House. The Oaks provides an appetizing breakfast -- an expanded Continental breakfast which includes some hot dishes. Parking is included as well, so this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: nicsterscotland
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in the garden district close to st Charles avenue for street car to French quarter. Loads of great places to eat and drink near by in both st Charles and magazine street. Room was lovely and clean and good size would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not all that it's made out to be”
Reviews.Author: Hombre-15
Reviews.Content: It's an old apartment house that's been converted into a semi-B&B.... For the price, I think you could be closer to the French Quarter, but it is in a great location in the Garden District and has easy access to the St. Charles trolley that will take you to all the places you'd want to go. Not bad, but building has issues with noise HVAC and the nicer of the two is the Prytania Park (not Oaks) which sits across street.

Reviews.Title: “Ohhh Prytania Oak! Beautiful recovery”
Reviews.Author: Ellebb
Reviews.Content: Loved my room...it felt like I was in my own bedroom with a window terrace to the street. It wasn't a main street so the traffic wasn't too bad--and I was at meetings most of the day. Close to local eateries, and about 10 blocks from the French quarter. Its a nice walkable mile to the convention center. Only downside is that I flew in late and didn't realize I had to check-in at the Prytania before going to my hotel. So I had to drag my luggage back and forth. There is no elevator to get to the 2nd floor rooms--which was fine for me but for the physically challenged should be aware. Lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonTexas
Reviews.Content: We booked this on-line with never seeing it except for the pictures. The yellow building is the Oaks. And the gate in the front requires your room key to enter. We stayed for 6 days. Actually we were booked for 5 but got mixed up and showed up a day early. No Problem! They put us in the same room we'd reserved for our stay. Room 164 didn't have an internet signal so I spoke with the desk and we worked through it. They called the tech after they gave me an Ethernet cable and it failed. The tech guy fixed it and I stayed on the cable. It was fast and not a problem. We looked at moving to a different room but we liked the layout of 164. It had a lager vanity area in the bathroom and a tub/shower. Hey and the commode was maybe a handicap toilet because it sat higher. The 4 poster bed was very comfy, the armoire was large and the chest of drawers held a refrig and a microwave and coffee maker on top. The Oaks is half a block from the morning breakfast but that wasn't a problem. They had yogurt, sweet rolls and cereal. Also juice, coffee and bagels. It wasn't lavish or hot but it was good for a start of the day. We were 1 block away from the Mardi Gras parade route and really enjoyed the close proximity. We parked off the street in the Oaks lot. The office staff was great at every opportunity. They offered ideas on eating and transportation. Our room was kept neat and tidy by the maid service. What's not to like!? We enjoyed the Prytania Oaks very much.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed, I'd give 2nd chance but my hubby says he wouldn't.”
Reviews.Author: BRM47
Reviews.Content: This is a mixed review based on one two-night experience of only one particular room. The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. These are always the most important to me. I would return, but expecting less and avoiding room 264. It didn't get internet signal, the room was too small for a reading chair, so I had to sit on the bed always if my husband was using the one desk chair. There was only one nightstand meaning my book and glasses had to go on the floor, and we slept with earplugs due to the cooler unit outside the window which cycled on and off all night. Cons have been written by many others. Getting to the hotel gate only to see a sign indicating that you will have to drag the luggage down the block and across two streets to check in at the sister hotel. That info should be emphasized on the reservation beforehand. We would have parked in the other hotel's lot for convenience during check in. Or rolling out of bed to find out no one is available to serve breakfast in the nice breakfast room on-site that has tables. Instead, you have to go to the other hotel where there is no place to sit down, so you juggle coffee, a roll, yogurt or cereal while standing or balance it all while walking across the streets and through the locked gate to your room. This has been written about so many times that it doesn't seem like an isolated incident. They need to get their staffing problems dealt with and open the breakfast room on a regular basis. It should be part of what we are paying more for at the Oaks. I had higher expectations (my fault) based on what people had written and due to the wording I read and heard from the hotel: "Garden District Collection of Fine Boutique Hotels." It is a collection of three but not a boutique hotel. It's not in the Garden District, but ten blocks away in an area sometimes called Lower Garden District. The two areas are very distinct.The Room Maintenance card states "engineering department." I saw a maintenance man. It's too bad the wording stretches the truth. I know the owner wrote on Trip Adviser to someone who had complained that "you get what you pay for" so I shouldn't have thought it was really in the Garden District for the price. It is a collection of three clean, nicely furnished little hotels at a price which is reasonable for New Orleans. That should be good enough.

Reviews.Title: “European-style, Old New Orleans Feel - Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheLadyEv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to New Orleans to view a sailboat and wanted a nice hotel without spending a fortune. Reserved two rooms at the Prytania Oaks based on other travelers reviews. Was really concerned as we were driving to the property, but remembered another review that said the neighborhood a few blocks away was questionable, but it is New Orleans... When we reached the property, the neighborhood changed considerably to quiet, tree-lined European-style streets with lovely statues and gardens. The room had incredibly high ceilings with solid, elegant wooden furniture and marble counters in the bathroom. Our room was in a separate building from the main lobby, but that was fine as we never had to go to the main desk. Never got the WiFi to work, but I carry a MiFi, so I didn't ask for help. The room was clean and very quiet. Never heard anybody else and had great nights' sleep. Breakfast was served in a small garden house across a walkway. Only had coffee as the pastries were packaged and I don't eat waffles, although they looked good; there was a very nice woman making them to order and there were cherries and syrup to put on top. Otherwise, cold cereal and instant oatmeal and grits. I'm from the south; in some areas it's illegal to offer/eat instant grits ;-) Turned out we had booked during Carnival (didn't know that going in...) and streets all around us were blocked off for the parades. Couldn't get taxis or the street cars, so walked to the French Quarter, which didn't take long at all. Not sure exactly how long it took because we were having so much fun taking in the sights and talking to people. Great location, quiet, clean rooms, good price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: graycf
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA for work, staying in the loud, busting French Quarter. My first trip so I decided to stay on through the weekend and booked the Pyrtania Oaks based on Tripadvisor reviews. I am so glad I did. You wouldn't know what was in store when checking in around the corner- the Pyrtania/Terpsichore area is a bit run-down and off the beaten track. However once in my room at the Oaks, I was delighted. LOVELY room- large, with a comfortable 4-poster bed, hardwood floors, a fireplace, 12 foot ceilings and an incredibly efficient AC. The room was quiet, the location accessible to all NOLA has to offer, the staff helpful and friendly- and the price, amazing. I can't wait to return. This one is a real jewel.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: marciamcb
Reviews.Content: Stay here for a remarkable experience in NOLA. Great area for the beauty and serenity of NOLA but not too far from all the action of the French Quarter. 1 block from the St. Charles Streetcar. They offer beautifully appointed rooms, 12' ceilings, incredibly comfortable beds, luxurious linens, the quiet and peacefulness needed after a long day out. Super friendly staff, free parking and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “What a deception”
Reviews.Author: Canadians-in-UK
Reviews.Content: Let me be frank: I am the second person in the party of VoyageurAylmer whose review was published a few weeks ago. I will not come back on what he wrote but will write my own review. We stayed at the Prytania Oaks for 2 nights in December (24th, 25th). I have nothing bad to say about the physical hotel/room. It was clean and quiet. We were on the second floor with a view on the street and the room had a little balcony. Since it was nice outside, it was great to use it although there was only 1 chair for 2 people. The water pressure in the shower was great. There is free Internet and free parking (a big plus but we found 3 free parking spots downtown on the South-East corner of Camp St./Poydras just besides a paying parking lot.) Besides the service, we were disappointed with the location and the breakfast. The location was so-so. Yes, it is only a block to get on the St-Charles tram but if you want to walk, it is not great. To go to the Vieux CarrÃ©, it takes between 20 and 35 minutes (I timed it) depending on how fast you walk and you have to walk under some kind of overpass. Not great at night. The Garden District is about a 10-12 minutes walk in the other direction. As far as the breakfast goes, it was a buffet situated in the lobby of the Prytania PARK hotel, across the street. It was awful to have to go over there and come back with your hands full or with a tray and try to open the gate. Standing in the lobby to eat would have been as awkward. The choice was also very basic: store-bought jelly Danishes, packs of grits and oatmeal, juice and milk, yogurt. There were no fruit the 2 days I was there and even though there were individual packs of butter and jam, there were no plain croissant, bread or bagel to smear them on. The 2 days we had breakfast there, we had another breakfast about 1 hour later. Now, let me come back to the response of the manager of my husband's review since there are a couple of inaccuracies in them that make us look stupid. 1) The OTA we used was not Canadian nor obscure. It was CheapOair.com. 2) The manager writes that she has never heard of it but strangely when the front desk clerk called her to explain the mix-up and asked what to do, she said to the clerk who repeated to us: "Yes, other customers complained about this site and we have registered a complain with the Better Business Bureau. The problem is that they used the details of the Prytania Oaks for Prytania Park and vice-versa." Clearly, they had knowledge of this problem before. 3) Twice she says that they "showed" us something on their computer. They never showed us anything. They "told" us. Anyway, I believe that their computer and our papers were not saying the same thing. The problem lies elsewhere. In her response, the manager is very condescending, uses adages and makes it sound like we are novice travelers, not smart for booking through an OTA and that we were taught a good lesson. We have lived in different parts of the world and traveled all over. We always book through OTA, never direct. And we have never had any problems except this time. We were completely floored when this happened. It was X-Mas Eve, the day before had been my birthday, we had booked this months in advance and this is how we were treated. Let me add that the manager never showed up. It was the front desk clerk who called to see if he could do something but the manager said plainly no. We were amazed and shocked but never started yelling in anger even though we said we would definitely write it on TripAdvisor. I kept repeating: "This is incredible. I've never seen such practice before." The lobby is under video and audio surveillance. Please look again at your footage. I don't know if the owners and the manager are one person. If so, there is nothing to do about it. If not, I think it is high time management be evaluated too. I say "too" because on the cards where guests can leave comments, it says that employees are evaluated and that their monthly bonuses depend on the reviews. Also I find it very odd that every time the manager replies to a bad review, it is never her fault. Never once does she takes responsibility. The hotel will never be able to make itself better with such attitude. I am sure the manager will answer something to my review and it is her right to defend herself but keep in mind that in her response to my husband's review, there were 3 inaccuracies in it so whatever she writes back, take it with a grain of salt. You can say the same thing about my review and think that I am just a traveler scorned, but look at my contributions. I have several and know how to travel and know when service is good or bad. I will not come back to this hotel even though I'll definitely be back in New Orleans. Before choosing this hotel, read all the reviews, good and bad, and the manager's answers carefully and read the reviews for Prytania Park too since this is the same management.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it is rated to be”
Reviews.Author: TEX2MD
Reviews.Content: We had pretty much decided we were not going to stay here again but after the last 24 hours, we definitely are not. The last night we were there, one of my pillows fell to the floor. When I bent down to get it, I glanced under the bed, it had fur balls everywhere under the bed. Our room had hardwood floors. I called the front desk to complain. The person who answered the front desk phone said she could not do nothing until the next day. We had a early flight so we were gone. I took a picture of the fur balls. I am not going to upload unless a traveler asks for it. The GM called and apologized and blamed it on the Executive Housekeeper being on vacation?!?! How long has this employee been on vacation? 6 months? And she is the GM, she should be taking responsibility, not passing it off on an employee. She is responsible party. The continental breakfast is awkward. It is held at the other property and is a block away. Who wants to carry two cups of coffee and a couple of danish back to your room walking down a street? They promote being green. Well, it takes 40 seconds, yes I timed it, for hot water to show up in the bathroom sink. How green is that? The pros are the bed was very comfortable and our room was very quiet. I mean we never saw or heard another guest or staff member during our 4 day stay while in our room.

Reviews.Title: “very good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: terrysawyers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor. It already had good ratings. The rooms are like new. New bathroom and furnishings. Very clean. The rooms are a little small but plenty big enough for two people. It is very close to St. Charles street where you find very good small resturants and the street car that takes you downtown to Bourbon street. The staff that we met were very friendly. We didn't try the continental breakfast. We instead found a small cafe nearby that had a very good and inexpensive breakfast. We got a good taste of New Orleans staying at this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and beautiful accommodations in a great location in the Big Easy!”
Reviews.Author: debbiesdreamtrips
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my first trip to New Orleans a few days ago and have been chomping at the bit to write this review of the beautiful and charming Prytania Oaks Hotel. Not to sound like a broken record (since everyone seems to use this word to describe the place), but what a GEM! Seriously... it is beautiful and charming. So, here's the scoop: The Room: We were in Room 267 and had a balcony view overlooking Prytania Street. The moment we walked in the room, I was all ooo's and ahhhh's! There were beautiful hardwood floors, a queen-sized four poster bed, a desk, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, an armoire, a mounted flatscreen tv, HUGE vaulted ceilings (at least 12 feet high), and two sets of the most gorgeous french doors leading out to a lovely balcony just outside of the room overlooking the street. The bathroom was beautiful, even down to the detail they put into framing out the sink with some lovely crown. Very nice. I will admit that the room would have been cramped if we had giant luggage (no place other than the skinny armoire to store suitcases or spread out, but we only had our small weekend bags, so we kept them on the desk and in the nice sized foyer by the door. The space was absolutely perfect for what we needed and was really clean and classy. It felt like a real treat to have the pleasure to stay there. Comfort: The bed was comfortable and the pillows were fine, though I have to admit... I am partial to feather pillows and was a little disappointed that this amazing room did not have them. Oh well. Out of fairness, I did not ask if they had any feather pillows because the pillows were comfortable enough that it wasn't a big deal. The shower was wonderful! I loved the heavy water pressure (it was heavenly and I kept raving about it!) but, apparently, I spent a little too long enjoying my shower bc my husband said the temp never really got hot enough for his liking (which wasn't my experience at all). The next day I took a more responsible shower (wasn't in there for an eternity-- ha!) and hubby said the temperature was perfect, so I really think it was my fault that first day. The thermostat kept the temperature just perfect for us and there was a ceiling fan should we have needed it (though we didn't since there was a cold front those two nights). The comforter looks thin but kept us plenty warm and very comfy. Light/Noise: We were in love with the black-out curtains they had in the room, which kept it nice and dark for a restful night's sleep. As for noise, while I am a super heavy sleeper, my husband is not and did mention that he could hear people walking up/down the stairwell late at night and dragging their luggage down the stairs first thing in the morning. He could also hear the street noise whenever a car drove by, but not so much so that any of this made it difficult for him to sleep, which was good. I would recommend that light sleepers not request a street view though because there would be a higher chance of any noise distracting you. Again, as a heavy sleeper, I slept like a baby so it was perfect to me. :-) Convenience/Location: The Prytania Park Hotel (sister property) is just across the street, caddy corner from the Prytania Oaks and is where you check in. The staff was great! Dana, in particular, took a lot of time with me to provide restaurant suggestions and such-- she was fantastic and so, so helpful (thanks, Dana!). We parked our car in the free (and well-lit) parking lot over by the main office, which seemed preferable to parking in one of the only five or six spots that are adjacent to the Prytania Oaks building. And the location of the hotel to the hot spots of New Orleans was excellent-- 1.7 miles from the French Quarter (which we walked-- only took about 35-4o minutes on foot and it provided a beautiful stroll through lovely old homes, pretty parks, and even some of the downtown skyscrapers-- great diversity! The hotel is situated in the Garden District and is conveniently just one-two blocks from the St Charles trolley (a $3 per person ticket for a full day of unlimited rides on the city trolleys/buses). While we opted to just explore on foot, it was nice knowing the trolley was there as a back-up plan and it was fun to see it passing through the city. :-) There are lots of great food options on St Charles Street, so the fact that we were so close by to that major thoroughfare was a major plus during our stay! Free Breakfast: A continental breakfast is served from 7:30-9:00 (or was it 7:00am?-- anyway, you get the idea) and had cereal, danishes, and a waffle maker, plus juice, milk, and coffee. Pretty simple, but plenty. :-) While we were there, they served breakfast at Prytania Oaks but sometimes serve it at the Prytania Park lobby-- they tell you at check-in where you can expect it to be each day on your stay. Other tips: If you have a car while in New Orleans and are able to explore more than just the French Quarter, take a drive down to the end of St. Charles and Magazine Streets in the Garden District area. The houses there are out of this world! Also, Metairie Cemetery is something to behold (wow!) and seeing Lake Pontchartrain just a few miles north of the city on Lakeshore Drive is worth the 18 minutes or so that it takes to get up there. It is so close by and is worth checking out at sunset if you have the benefit of having a car while there-- lovely! I loved exploring the streets of the French Quarter (the street performers are a hoot!) but have to admit that the 45 minute wait we had at Cafe Du Monde to get their world famous beignets (power-sugared covered donut treats) was a let-down. I still recommend you have a beignet while there though-- it is just a NOLA thing that you would not want to miss out on and, were it not for the long wait, I probably would have LOVED it! Just try to go later in the afternoon... after 4pm maybe... because the crowds just make the lines ridiculous any earlier in the day. Pictures: Check out the pictures entitled Room 267 to see our room. I hope this review was helpful and that you have a GREAT time on your trip to New Orleans. Don't hesitate to book this hotel-- you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super friendly staff, comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: carouselgirl1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night in New Orleans. Check in was at the other hotel two blocks away where we received a super friendly greeting from reception. Our room was on the upper level and had everything you need: nice flat screen, fridge, desk, microwave, kettle, free wifi (take note Hyatt Lost Pines!), decent sized bathroom (no bath but nice big shower cubicle). Decoration is tasteful and the room was nice and clean. Location is great, just one block from the St Charles streetcar and a really great bar called The Avenue which I cant recommend highly enough but thats for a whole other review! Prytania Oaks is a good choice for any NOLA visit. Oh yes you also get free parking in the lot next door

Reviews.Title: “Nice, old New Orleans feel”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. Economical and a very nice New Orleans feel. It's in an old house in an old neighborhood. The room was small but very neat and clean. Decorated very nicely. It was within walking distance to several restaurants and bars and a street car line. If you want something that is not the typical hotel feel, we highly recommend this place. The person at the desk was very friendly and helpful. The only downside is the doors close a little loudly with this being an old house, we were awakened by people coming into the house. They had a free breakfast which is not something you will get at the large hotels.

Reviews.Title: “"A very nice, well-located, small hotel"”
Reviews.Author: FireballNashville
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel located in an old, renovated home in the Garden District of New Orleans. Though the rooms are small, they are very attractive, very clean, and beautifully decorated. The beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are large and very accommodating in every way. Check-in takes place in a nearby adjoining hotel. A nice continental breakfast is provided. Desk staff are very helpful and friendly. Very importantly, this hotel is located just one block from the St. Charles streetcar line which takes you the eight or ten blocks down to the central business district and the French Quarter. Some of the areas surrounding this hotel look pretty bad but the hotel is very safe and secure. We had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Sam F
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Halloween weekend for the festivities and also to attend the Voodoo Music Festival. It is located just outside the Garden District, meaning it's far enough away from the French Quarter for you to enjoy a relaxing brunch at the many restaurants nearby, whilst only being one block off St Charles Street and consequently only a 10 minute street car ride into the Quarter for a night out. The rooms are very well maintained, the staff are more than helpful and very knowledgable regarding NOLA and the surrounding area. Breakfast is included, and whilst its nothing to write home about, its adequate. It's only served until 9am, but if you have a late night and can't make it by then, you're probably in need a more substantial feed anyway (we were!). We had no problems walking in the area at night. There is a convenience store, pharmacy and laundromat in close proximity. Basically, if we are ever in NOLA again, we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B”
Reviews.Author: NOLA_2011
Reviews.Content: Great B&B - an old building converted to 6 rooms or so. Free wifi and parking and a pretty good b'fast, too. We love staying in the lower garden district and have already made reservations for 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: LoriCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was at least $30 cheaper than hotels closer to the French Quarter, plus it had free parking and free breakfast. Most hotels near the French Quarter charged about $30 a night for parking. It's very close to the St. Charles street car line, located just between the French Quarter and the Garden District, so it's easy to get around, but we ultimately decided it would have been nice to stay closer to the French Quarter. The rooms were beautiful and spotless. It's set up like a bed and breakfast. We were on the first floor and it was a little noisy at night when people would come in very late, we could hear them opening the main door and climbing the stairs. The complimentary breakfast was nice -- served in a room across the driveway. There are outdoor tables so you can enjoy your breakfast in the sun. Selection was limited but it was all we needed -- apples and oranges, cereal, oatmeal, croissants, coffee, juice...we saw some people eating waffles but we could never figure out how they made them! But on our last day, the breakfast room was closed. There were no signs offering an explanation, so we called the front office. They said breakfast was over at the Prytania Parks hotel. It's very close by, so we walked there. It was the same selection (minus the waffles), but the setting was not nearly as nice -- the food was served in a small outdoor hallway, and instead of actual dishes everything was plastic and styrofoam. The Prytania Oaks was a very cute hotel and a good choice if you're trying to save some money, (the free parking was great, we parked our car when we got there and didn't use it again until we left) but I'm not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Courteous Mgt”
Reviews.Author: gdhorytwo
Reviews.Content: I recently completed my second stay with this family of hotels. The Prytania Oaks seems a little nicer than the Prytania Park, both were pleasant stays. Prytania Oaks provides a little more of a feel of being a guest in a house rather than simply staying in an average hotel. You have your privacy, but you also have hardwood floors, high ceilings, real furniture, and a nice homey feel. Both the Park and the Oaks provide a sense of security with the secluded breezeway and court yards. The staff has been welcoming, helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in New Orleans 'Garden District'”
Reviews.Author: hirondelle11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this delightful, charming, clean und quiet hotel.When I was looking for suitable accomodation, I was torn between a hotel in the French Quarter and the Prytania Oaks Hotel. We were so glad we chose the latter! We couldn't have found a better place to stay. The rooms are relatively small, but hey - this is New Orleans and who wants to spend a lot of time in the room anyway? We returned only to sleep in a comfortable queen size bed. Everything is spotlessly clean and new with a great bathroom and a good shower. Complimentary breakfast was alright, although we would have preferred a more wholesome and healthier choice: maybe some muesli and some wholewheat muffins/bread. It was served at the Prytania Park Hotel which is just a short walk away. Check-in is also at the Prytania Park Hotel and you are well advised to leave your luggage in the car, otherwise you will have to put it in again when you drive to the parking area of the Prytania Oaks Hotel a few blocks further. We can certainly recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a quiet room with easy access to all the attractions in downtown New Orleans. The streetcar is just around the corner or you can walk to the French Quarter in about 20 minutes if you are a brisk walker.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with a great central location”
Reviews.Author: themandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for 4 nights at the Prytania Oaks Hotel and found it perfect for our needs. The room was very nice, with a comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. Our room was located on the second floor in the back of the building. We never once heard any street noise or noise from other people staying at the hotel. My favorite part of the room was the included fridge and microwave. More hotels should provide these amenities. Front desk staff was very friendly when we checked in and when we needed to make change for the streetcar. Speaking of the streetcar, the Prytania Oaks couldn't be in a more convenient location. We spent a lot of time uptown (rather than just hanging out in the French Quarter), so I appreciated being able to hop on the St. Charles streetcar just a block from the hotel. We were able to park in the adjacent free, offstreet parking lot and never needed our car the entire trip. I can't comment on the breakfast, because we were never awake early enough to take advantage of it. Overall, I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you want a great value and don't mind being a few minutes from the action instead of being right in the middle of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: Hard to fault, really. Lovely old restored house on a street which can get busy-ish but never seemed noisy. Free parking right next to the hotel. One block from St Charles Street and it's streetcar. Hotel breakfast is at an adjacent, related hotel and is basic but perfectly adequate. There is a small but well stocked supermarket (Zara's) a few blocks away on Prytania. We had decent food and service on St Charles St at Voodoo BBQ and St Charles Tavern.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, Location, Service, and Value”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to NO in two years, and I guess this one was the charm. This hotel was absolutely ideal, with genuine Garden District charm combined with up-to-date convenience and comfort. My king room stepped out onto a spacious front porch on Prytania Street. The room was extremely spacious, with a very comfortable bed, desk and chair, side chair, great storage space, security safe, flat panel TV, wifi, microwave, frig, coffee maker, spacious bath, and separate vanity area with a second sink -- plus the character of high ceilings, old paneled doors, wood plank floors, and large windows. This is a sister property to the Prytania Park Hotel, just around the corner, but here at the Oaks, no children are allowed (I think I've died and gone to heaven). Check-in was gracious and friendly, and on-site parking is free. The hotel is a block from St Charles and the streetcar, so even if you aren't a walker, you can get anywhere easily. Emeril's Delmonico is three blocks away, the WW II Museum is only a half mile, and there is a myriad of services within easy walking distance of this lovely hotel. Compared to the French Quarter or the popular Warehouse District, this Garden District location is a peaceful escape. There is some traffic on Prytania by day, but only sporadically -- and it was never an issue for sleeping at night. Did I mention that this hotel is a killer value? When I return to NO, this is absolutely where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Silver60s
Reviews.Content: A well-priced small hotel on the edge of the Garden District and reasonably convenient for the city centre - either by walking (10-15 mins) or by tram (5 mins or so). The surrounding area is a bit scruffy and you probably want to take care if you were out walking after dark. Facilities were clean and adequate. Breahfast was pretty basic and a bit disappointing compared to the usual standard of US hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, superb stay, & superb hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jermstick
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. All pros & no cons. A must stay for anyone visiting NOLA. We are all born & raised in NOLA & now live in GA. & AL., but we come home quite often throughout the year. Prytania Oaks will be our hotel of choice from this point on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: CaraBeanZA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Prytania Oaks for four nights this month. The room was clean, cool and comfortable, and we even had our own small balcony, from which I loved to watch people walk, cycle and drive by. The neighbourhood is old, quaint and quiet. The St. Charles streetcar is only a block away, which makes it very easy to access other areas like the French Quarter. However, there are many excellent shops, sights and restaurants close by. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful, and provided me with maps, magazines, and excellent recommendations. I highly recommend the Prytania Oaks, and if I'm ever in New Orleans again, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JA07
Reviews.Content: The staff were great... very friendly and accomodating. And, the hotel is very quaint and attractive. Our room was facing the street and had a great front porch, but the room itself was disappointing. The bed was extremely uncomfortable with a cheap mattress and cheap linens. The extra blanket provided was dirty. There was no bathtub in the room, only a standing shower that almost blew me down when I turned on the water. The water pressure was ridiculous! The floors were nice wood, but they were very dirty. And, the best advice I can give is to skip the breakfast. OMG, it was a joke. The best part of our stay at Prytania Oaks was the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_deek
Reviews.Content: We loved our room .. the shower was the best! Very clean and well located. You have to check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Back home for my 50th birthday”
Reviews.Author: Arabella-HoustonTX
Reviews.Content: Went back home to New Orleans for my 50th birhtday and did not want to stay in a major hotel. As seen from my previous reviews, we like smal boutique hotels. Well we couldn't have chosen a better place. We loved it here. Only one block to the streetcar line and very convenient to all that NOLA has to offer. The rooms have been remodeled and are beautiful. High ceilings and wood floors. We felt like we were staying at a private home instead of a hotel. The staff were very friendly and Tricia was our lady for breakfast in the morning. She was a sweetheart. I have a sneaky suspition that this is a female owner and she knows exactly what she is doing!! Will definitely be staying here anytime we visit NOLA. Thanks so much for a wonderful 50th birthday!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: sraeemery
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for four nights with my daughter. Nice safe neighborhood, convenient to street car and walking distance to restaurants. The room was spotless, as were the grounds. We had a room on the second floor in the back and it was very quiet, which I appreciated. There were only a few minor things that could have been better. We checked in and were told where to park but weren't told how to get into the property or where our room was. It wasn't too hard to figure out but it would've been helpful to have been told. Several times there was no parking in either lot but on street parking was available for free. And the breakfast left a lot to be desired but as others have said, we're not there for the free continental breakfast. I would suggest adding yogurt and fruit. There was no place to sit in our room other than the bed or a desk chair. The addition of a comfy chair would be nice although I don't know if one would fit in the room. The price for this hotel was a steal, all things considered. Would go back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find!”
Reviews.Author: officecomputer
Reviews.Content: We only had two days and one night in New Orleans, so a great hotel was essential. Prytania Oaks was the perfect find. It is a beautiful home in the garden district converted into a hotel just one block off the St. Charles trolley line. The room was clean, non-smoking, and tastefully remodeled with granite counter tops and a flat screen TV. The king size bed was comfortable and the bench on the front porch made a great place to relax. It was an excellent value for the money and Bourbon street was an easy few minutes away. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from the French Quarter with free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_QBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: The Prytania Oaks is one of three related properties within a block or so of each other. The Oaks, at least, is a converted historic home, and has the charm and elegance of a turn-of-the century mansion. Our room was in the front on the top floor, with a shared balcony. It was too hot to use it in June, but at another time of year, we could imagine sitting out there with our coffee in the morning and a stronger drink later. The entire building has been recently renovated, with modern fixtures in the large bathroom. Our room had a sink and counter outside of the bathroom, as well, which was very convenient in the mornings. Very comfortable bed; the usual coffee maker, iron and ironing board, and toiletries. The hotel is on a quiet street, just one block from the St. Charles Street car, which had us to Canal street in a matter of minutes. The WWII museum is just a couple of stops away, and there are restaurants in the neighborhood that are much less expensive, quieter, and less crowded than those in the tourist areas. Very pleasant, very accommodating staff, although they should have more than one person on the desk at the check-in time. We were given no instructions on how to get to our room -- we had to go around to the side of the building and through a door to an interior stairway -- primarily because the young woman at the desk was trying to check us in and handle the phones at the same time. The door to the stairs was marked with the room numbers, but we had to find it first! The complimentary breakfast includes fresh waffles, instant hot cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee, fresh fruit, breads -- I don't know what other reviewers are complaining about. The only negative was that the locks on the windows leading to the balcony were broken; one came right out of the frame! There was no way to the balcony except through the rooms that opened onto it, but I was still glad that I hadn't taken my laptop with me. And when they say check-in is at 4:00, they mean it! We arrived about 2:00, were allowed to park the car in the lot, and told that the room would be ready in about 30 minutes. We walked up to the St. Charles Pub, had a drink, wandered around, returned at 3:30, to be told that the room would not be ready until 4:00. Why promise us 2:30, then? What really rankled was watching others arrive -- at least one without a reservation -- and check in while we waited. Apparently the Oaks is that last of the three properties to be cleaned. We'll know better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - more like staying in your own home!”
Reviews.Author: NomskiNY
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel with no annoying lobby and fussing staff. Just like staying in your own house - it is quiet, clean and the rooms are very well furnished. You have your own key. Short walk in to town - closeby . Definitely recommend this place. Only thing it lacked was a pool!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this private and clean place”
Reviews.Author: Halgot
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for a week from the 24th May - 1st June. It was above expectation considering how cheap it is. We stayed in a Superior Queen Room which had a super comfy bed! It was clean and new but still had a nice warm vintage feel to it. The air conditioning was very quiet and our room was facing the courtyard so it was really easy to sleep. There is a lovely big shower with a place to sit down - perfect for tired legs when you've been walking around all day in the heat and your feet are swollen! The rail-car is really close and very handy transportation if it's to hot to walk in to town. We walked to Canal St on one of the days and it was fine but just a bit too hot to handle in the middle of the day. The breakfast was the only thing we weren't happy with. A few extremely sweet pastries, cereal and toast were the only options, but it didn't really matter as we found a really nice place just down the road called Blue Plate CafÃ© on 1330 Prytania Street. It has an amazing selection of breakfast and is only 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The staff were nice and helpful with everything. I have no complaints and we will definitely stay again when we come back to New Orleans - and we will - we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: T-Binger
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. My wife was hesitant because it seemed out of the way but it was great. It was just a one block walk to the St. Charles Street Car which took us back and forth to the Quarter. The room was beautifully done in a restored mansion. Parking was free and the breakfast buffet was in a beautiful room with French doors opening to the nice courtyard. While you have to check in at the Prytania Park Hotel which is half a block away, we pulled up, checked in and drove the half block to our parking lot which is not much different than many hotels. In fact, down in the Quarter, parking is often quite a distance from your hotel. We would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in every way in the New Orleans Garden District”
Reviews.Author: RockoVentura
Reviews.Content: Large rooms in a small, clean and quiet hotel. Very friendly and conscientious personnel. Extraordinary service example: Forgot shoes, called hotel and they were more than happy to package and mail them to me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities with old style elegance”
Reviews.Author: tbenus
Reviews.Content: The room is approx 12x14 with 12+ foot ceilings. The modern bath while not large is more than adequate. The furnishings show no wear and are very well maintained. Housekeeping comes later in the day in case you want to sleep in after a night of entertainment. However the "old style' affects that amount of dark in the room while you are trying to sleep. The doors are not tight and with the light in the hallway it's like sleeping with a bright night light. Concerns about crime and being accosted on the street are unfounded. You can walk to the street car stop. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Local restaurants with excellent menus are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: telegirl68
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I chose this hotel in part because of the pretty old typical new Orleans look in the photos. When we were dropped off at the address in our confirmation, there was a sign directing us to go around the corner, so we trundles over there with our bags, an inauspicious beginning. Turns out they have three properties, and most guests do no stay in the pretty old places, the prytania oaks and queen anne hotels, but the newer Prytania Park, which is more like the hotel rooms found anywhere. If you want that classic old house feel, be sure to specify that in you reservation! But we were too tired to fight, and went to our room, which had a spiral staircase up to a laft with the second queen bed,which my daughter immediately claimed. The room was clean, a perfect temperature, had a small frig, microwave and coffee maker, and hair dryer. Big flat screen tv and blackout curtains, and my favorite, a power strip next to the bed so I could charge my phone, iPad, and Verizon hotspot modem and still use them from bed. Aahhhhhh! There are a bunch of great restaurants a block away on St. Charles; i had a soft-shell crab sandwich at the St. Charles Tavern, which is open 24 hours, and a fabulous breakfast at the Blue Plate Cafe, 3 blocks away. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful at all times. Very good hotel....

Reviews.Title: “WILL STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: hodagtravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice place to stay. This was our first time in NOLA and it proved a pleasant accomodation. We stayed in a 2nd floor room. The bed was very comfortable and we didn't here any noise from other guests. We loved our balcony. The staff was very personable and friendly. They offered us local options for dining. The location was great for our needs. 1 block to the St. Charles Streetcar. Took it by day and by night without issue. Several local restaurants nearby which offered variety and good food. The Avenue Pub was a nice local establishment with over 30 different beers to choose from. A Walgreens was within a few blocks for shopping needs. The Garden District was beautiful. Near Magazine Street shopping. Able to get to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter by streetcar in 10 or 15 min. I was most impressed with the staff noting my request for no down or feather pillows or comforter. I place this request with every hotel reservation and this was the ONLY hotel to ever have the room prepared as such BEFORE I arrived. LOVED this place.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Customer Service and unique Garden District Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateaux54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to cancel our trip due to a friend's serious illness. In addition to handling our cancellation with courtesy, management took responsibility for seeing that we were contacted regarding credit to our credit card. They contacted us twice and handled it all with incredible efficiency and kindness. This is the personal service that is growing less common in all service industries and we will return to Prytania to reward such a rare attitude. Accommodations are exemplary, rooms are more luxurious than pictured and convenient to all areas of New Orleans; the unique streetcar experience is difficult to match anywhere. We travel often and live near New Orleans and are always looking for small, intimate settings in the Crescent City. The Garden District is as New Orleans as the French Quarter and you owe it to yourself to stay here for the atypical experience of the US city that is 'more European than many European cities' we have visited! Our highest compliments to the personal service provided by the Prytania staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “We were so lucky to find the Prytania Oaks Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Glassartist01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prytania Oaks Hotel in the Garden District of New Orleans the night before leaving on a cruise from the Port of New Orleans. This is a gem! It is located in a refurbished older home that is simply lovely. Our room had high ceilings, beautiful dark wood floors, a large modern bath with black and white tile (with both a large tub and separate shower) and looked out onto a balcony overlooking the quiet street. It is one block from St. Charles Street (where there are many interesting restaurants) and the street cars. A continental breakfast was included. It was lovely, quiet and easy to get to the port (either by streetcar or cab). We would definitely stay there again and have already recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful and Quiet Place”
Reviews.Author: Marc4167
Reviews.Content: Recently I took my wife to New Orleans for her 40th birthday, and really lucked into Prytania Oaks. I read many of the reviews that was posted on Trip Advisor and did not read 1 bad thing about Prytania Oaks. So to say the least I had high expectations which they truely lived up to. Our Room was beautiful with a balcony overlookin Prytania Street. Coming out of our room was just a 1/2 block walk to the Trolley on St. Charles where for a $1.25 you can ride to the French Quarter, or if feel like a little exercise you can walk roughly 15 blocks to the French Quarter. The staff were very friendly and never bothered us one minute. They even allowed us to check in a little early and made a special effort to make sure our room was clean and ready for us. I highly recommend Prytania Oaks.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Charming in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LHatlelid
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending New Years Eve weekend in New Orleans, staying two nights at the Prytania Oaks Hotel. My expectations were definitely exceeded. Our room was #265, which is upstairs in the back, overlooking a courtyard area. The hotel is located in a residential area, and we felt very safe. The room was well-appointed and clean, and the bed was comfortable. There was ample hot water and great water pressure in the bathrooms. I described this hotel as quaint and charming, because it is more like a B&B than a chain hotel; with a nice mixture of original wood flooring in the room and granite counters in the bathroom. The location is great, and within walking distance of many restaurants and even the French Quarter. Parking was readily available in the small lot right next door. The only suggestion I would make would be to install some sort of bumper on the ground floor door. We could hear it slam when other quests came in and out. We really enjoyed ourselves here and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AllSunnyDays514
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The room was clean, quiet, and charming. Love the ceilings. Definitely stay here the next time I come to Nola. The ladies at check in were very nice and accomodating. The only issue I had was with the internet, never worked and kind of needed it for work; didn't feel like going across the street to the other Prytania Park hotel. I think the breakfast is pretty pathetic too, definitely need to work on that. Kind of the idea of staying at a B&B type place. The rooms in the oaks are very clean...I felt like it was a bedroom at home!! Immaculate and clean. I never had the chance to check out the Queen Anne but walked past is several times. Pretty victorian home. The location of all the properties is wonderful, close to restaurants, Magazine St, just a block from the St. Charles street car, short drive to the 10. They also have a security guard at night that patrols the area, very comforting even for a safe surrounding. I consider myself lucky to have found this place. It is certainly a gem in the garden district. Check out the photos! :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SionnaMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. We got in very late but we had a reservation, because there are two hotels we had to walk down the street to the other hotel but it wasn't far. The room was nice, with hardwood floors, a nice four post bed, flat screen tv, iron and blowdryer, a few toiletries, and the bathroom was fine.

Reviews.Title: “First time ok, second time disaster”
Reviews.Author: Trippin_Travels
Reviews.Content: First experience was about a year ago, it was ok. Away from the French Quarter scene, neighbor is average. We were going to return but my partner got sick and when we went to call they informed us that there will be a penalty due to it being within 48 hours. We would have to pay for one night and a cancellation charge. I told them she was sick, and the owner, Dori, wanted a doctors note stating she could not travel. Otherwise she would charge us for one night, so I said i would come down rather then go through all that trouble. Dori makes you feel as though you are a liar when your already upset... thank you Dori. Anyways, after that we hung up. I then called back to ensure I was only being charged for one night. They informed me that my reservation was for two nights and that I had to pay for both if I cancel. I told her that is not what the owner told me and she said she would call me back. Next day Dori calls back and says that if I cancel now she will charge me for both nights but her policy clearly states only one night... then before I even finish the conversation she informes me that she has ran my card for both nights and she now has HER money. So we are going to New Orleans....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New Orleans:}”
Reviews.Author: judi79
Reviews.Content: The best hotel that I have ever been to!!! I loved my room and The best hotel service ever! I am also a freelance photographer and took a few pics if y'all want them I can email them! Thanks again and I plan on staying here again from now on!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: jlwiebe
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night. The check-in is at the Prytania Park hotel down the street. This is a little inconvenient, especially since our cards stopped working 2 times during our stay and we had to walk over to get new ones. Security walked us over to the hotel. We picked this hotel for its location and value. My husband had a conference at the convention center. He was able to walk over every morning. It is a 15-20 minute walk. St. Charles street is one block away, and there are ample restaurants as well as a streetcar to take you towards the French Quarter. It was very easy to navigate around the city using public transportation. The only time we had to take a taxi was to and from the airport which was a standard fee of 33$.The value of the hotel was very good, especially since you could easily spend twice as much in a hotel closer to the French Quarter. Not to mention that the Garden District is much quieter. The hotel room itself is really nice. The floors are beautiful hardwood and the furniture (including a four-poster bed) was also lovely. The room was a little small, but it was clean, and as another person mentioned, you're there to see the city, not the inside of your room. The TV was a good size and the wireless internet worked pretty well. The bed was a little on the soft side but overall pretty comfortable. The AC worked well (definitely a necessity in New Orleans) and there was also a ceiling fan. The continental breakfast was sometimes at the Oaks and sometimes at the Park. It consisted of cereal, instant oatmeal, coffee, juice, danishes and croissants. On the weekend they also offered waffles. The staff was excellent. They helped us to book one of our tours and arranged for our cab to the airport. Overall we had a really nice stay and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet, clean hotel that is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and great value”
Reviews.Author: swan325
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my parents last weekend and I was a bit concerned because of the one horrible review but we had nothing to worry about. That reviewer's remarks were so off base. Beyond breakfast there really aren't any amenities or special services like bellman or gym but you're here to see New Orleans not the inside of a hotel. The hotel is in an old home so it has lots of character...hard woods, floor to ceiling windows, etc. We had the two upper rooms at the front with shared a balcony. All four of us were very happy with the rooms, the price and the quiet location. We had a rent car so having an FREE, off-street lot was great and the streetcar is one block away to get you into the Quarter (where finding any kind of parking is a challenge). Some might think it's away from the "action" but during our stay we visited many other parts of the city not just the Quarter so the location was good for us. Bottom line is I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T STAY -- too gross”
Reviews.Author: singinghope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had reservations to stay in December, 2009. I contacted the hotel several times to inquire as to whether we could check in early, as we were driving for 16 hrs prior to arriving. We were able to check in early, however the room we were given was beautiful, but DIRTY. There were large makeup stains all over the comforter and pillows. Then, when we pulled the sheets back, there were unmentionable hairs covering the sheets. Also, we were told that the rooms came with Queen size beds, but they were doubles. We have a Queen at home, we would know. The hotel front desk person let us look at rooms in each of the other 3 properties that they own, and each one had something wrong with it -- coffee stains on the bathroom floor (from a coffee spill and could have easily been mopped up) or a toilet with the seat up and fresh urine stains on the bowl. The only good thing about this reservation was that the hotel manager came in and called Expedia right away, in front of us, to cancel our reservation without any penalty or fee.

Reviews.Title: “An intimate hotel and a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: AuldPensacola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I opted to spend our 41st anniversary in New Orleans. We had visited NO (staying in the Quarter) frequently in the past but had not been back since Katrina. Also for the last 10-15 years we have travleled mostly in our motorhome so hotel/motel experience was infrequent. We decided to try the Garden District for a change; also the rates were more reasonable and felt it would be safer to park our car--at no expense. We stayed in a 2nd floor suite open to balcony; the room was obviously newly refurbished and very clean. The weather was moderate so heating/cooling was not an issue. We had easy access to the Quarter (both driving and by trolley) and would be happy to stay there another time. The neighborhood was quiet and traffic was light.

Reviews.Title: “Air Conditioner Problems”
Reviews.Author: cshells
Reviews.Content: There were record temperatures in NOLA when we were there in October. Instead of staying in a "chain" hotel like we normally do we decided to try something different this trip. Based on excellent reviews and special pricing and proxcimity to the street car line we opted for the Prytania Oaks. The air conditioning didn't work. We tried 2 different rooms. Neither one cooled off until the wee hours of the morning. The room we didn't stay in had a broken air conditioner. The other one had an air conditioner that was working according to the staff. We found out our last night that the problem was the hotel is on a water chill loop system. I dont' know whether it just couldn't handle the heat and humidity or whethr it had a central control (we were assured each room was on it's on control). My experience (from a past job) with a chill water system is that often it is controled from a central source. The staff was accomadating - however, there wasn't enough staff available. Only one person on duty to man the desk and take care of 3 small hotels located within a 2 block area.. Basic cleaning was good but there was quite a bit of dust. The rooms are small but to be expected in a house converted into a hotel. The hotel is only a block off St Charles and is being renovated house by house but there are still a number of houses within the block that are very run down. I do not recommend staying here when it is hot unless they have changed the air conditioning system.

Reviews.Title: “Independence Day 2009”
Reviews.Author: Arabella111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the toughest time, in locating a reasonably rated hotel, during such a busy time in NOLA, (July 4, 2009). Not only was it a holiday weekend but also the time of the Essence Festival. Those hotels that weren't fully booked were superinflated!! Well, while surfing the net, I stumbled upon "Bookit.com". I had honestly, not ever heard of this site but man-oh-mah, I'm so glad that I was led to it, (of course, by the Holy Spirit). We were able to book our air/hotel and car accommodations, at one time and the cost was unbelievable. When I saw the price of "The Prytania Oaks Hotel", I was really sceptical, for it seemed to good to be true. Fortunately, I have family in New Orleans, (it's my birthplace), so one of my sisters and my eldest daughter, both were able to go to the hotel and check it out. They know that I rank cleanliness above all else and both delivered very favorable comments. So, I felt confident in my selection of this hotel. You know, how sometimes pictures can be deceiving? Well, not with this one. In fact, the room we stayed in looks EXACTLY like one pictured here. It was so nice and I felt as though we weren't staying in a hotel at all, but with family. Actually, we didn't spend much time with the service people, but the front desk ladies were very hospitable. One checks in at the front desk of The Prytania Hotel, which is just around the corner, from The Prytania Oaks Hotel. I'm told the former is like a regular hotel but the latter, has more of a B & B feel to it. Our room had a king-size bed, (just like the one that's pictured); beautiful wood floors and armoire; a flat-screen t.v.; marble tile in the bathroom...beautiful high ceilings and ceiling fan; a fireplace, (which appeared to be the original one)...everything was just as pictured. Even with the king-size bed, the bedroom and dressing area was very spacious and I loved the bathroom! I guess one can say that The Prytania Oaks has a modernized/19th century feel and a Howard Johnson's mentality..."No surprises". What you see, pictured here, is what you get...and that's a lot!! Everything was so nice and clean, (just the way I like it), that I made sure I cleaned behind my husband, each day we were there...so the service people literally had nothing to do but change the linen on the bed; exchange the soiled towels for clean ones and then do (very) minimal cleaning. I made sure our room looked as though no one was even staying there, (lol) and had we not had any service, the entire time we were there, it really would've been fine...that's just how clean it was and I kept it that way. We already had plans, so we really didn't get a chance to do anything in that neighborhood but the next time we're there...which will probably be in September 2009, we'll do the Delmonicos (Emeril's) thing and ride the street car. The neighborhood is a wonderful one and very typical of the pre-Katrina New Orleans that we knew and loved. The next time we're there, we plan to tour the "Queen Anne" hotel, which is adjacent to "The Prytania Oaks". I understand, either the 'Oaks' or The Queen Anne has accommodations for up to 8, which would be ideal, for when we have all our children and grandbabies with us. Also, I hope to arrive, earlier in September, so we can get a room with a balcony!! So, if you're looking for a nice, clean place to stay...away from all the traffic of downtown and the Quarters, yet accessible to local/public transportation, while yet being able to enjoy the flavor of the immediate surroundings, try "The Prytania Oaks Hotel"...you won't regret it!!

HotelInfo.Name: Prytania Oaks Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1612 Prytania Street, New Orleans, LA 70130
